arm_group.description: subjects will be enrolled with advanced lung disease and each will undergo 2-4 6MWT with variable instructions.  Single arm study

brief_summary.textblock:
2-4 6MWT performed but with alternative wording and coaching in random order to determine
      differences in outcomes.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Six Minute Walk Test: Influence of Patient Effort on Results and Interpretation
clinical_study.condition: Each Patient Serves as His/Her Own Control.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  advanced lung disease such as COPD, ILD, IPF, or PAH

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  inability to walk, requiring supplemental oxygen, cardiac disease preventing
             successful 6MWT

facility.name: Inova Advanced Lung Disease and Transplant Program

clinical_study.official_title: Alternative Instruction in Six Minute Walk Test

other_outcome.measure: heart rate recovery at one minute

overall_official.affiliation: Inova Advanced Lung Disease and Transplant Program

primary_outcome.description: this is an ongoing study of same day testing of 2-4 six minute walk tests, each with different instructions, to determine the impact of alternative instruction on outcome of the test

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: assessed as an outcome of variable instruction given in different six minute walk tests performed in random order on the same day

collaborator.agency: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI)

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Open Label
